main event: Pilot spotted three bright lights traveling at high speed and making abrupt maneuvers over New Mexico in 1957.
interesting points: The objects came to an abrupt halt in the middle of air traffic, appeared stationary for about a minute, then continued at tremendous speed.

The pilot claims that when he realized the objects were on a collision course with him, he immediately flashed his taxi lights. One of the objects then shot straight up, while the other two continued past the aircraft.
When the pilot flashed his taxi lights, the objects immediately blacked themselves out and disappeared from sight within 5-10 seconds.
The objects were described as two bright lights, circular in shape, with a brilliant yellow color and a reddish tint.
The reported speed of the objects was estimated to be around 600 mph at the same altitude as the aircraft.
